answers.answer: Protein (essential amino acids) is the main ingredient that needs attention as a vegetarian. You get protein by using dairy products which can come from animal or plant sources, such as, milk, soy milk, rice milk, yogurt, soy yogurt, cheese, soy cheese, soy ice cream, and rice ice cream. For the plant protein, you need to combine grains and nuts / seeds for essential protein have to be used daily such as rice and beans, pasta and beans, nuts to oatmeal, peanut butter and bread, and salad and nuts. As a vegetarian you need to supplement Vitamin B12 and calcium because you do not get enough for the body through the vegetarian food sources. Good sources of information are the American Dietetic Association website, www.eatright.org and Vegetarian Resource Group website, www.vrg.org. A glucose tolerance test is the blood work for diabetes. It can be a 1hr, 2hr, or 3hr test. If you are still concerned, suggest having the test. Hoped this helped you.
Just invcase it helps I'm now a normal weight( was previosly a little on the skinny side despite eating like a horse)

question: So I went to my doctor a while back because I was really thirsty, unbeleivably hungry, really tired, and I kept feeling like I was going to faint.  He did blood tests but said he didn't find anything important.   So why do I feel like I can't get enough food or water.      I returned with a skin rash weeks ago and he gave me cream for it.   Although the actual rash has gone I still have big marks where the spots were.        I'm vegetarian and had an underactive theyoid but it leveled out as I grow older.      I'm I being paranoid or is it normal to be like this.
title: Feel like can't stop eating/drinking
